content.question: When computing a confidence interval for the slope of a regression line, a plot of the residuals versus the fitted values can be used to check which of the following conditions?

choices.label: The variables <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are inversely related.

The standard deviation of <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> does not vary as <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> varies.
The correlation is not equal to zero.

content.answer: The standard deviation of <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> does not vary as <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> varies.
